Re ''Justices Deny Grandparents Visiting Rights'' (front page, June 6): The Supreme Court's decision acknowledges that assumptions of parental autonomy based on the single nuclear family cannot be taken for granted. Divorce, decisions not to marry, single-parent households and the like have created more varied family structures than before.
It is a disservice to the children of this country to ignore their perception of what family is to them.

A woman who divorces her husband, or the mother of children whose father has died, may no longer be related to her children's paternal grandparents, but the children still have a connection to them through heritage and bloodlines. They are family to that child.
RICHARD S. VICTOR Bloomfield Hills, Mich., June 6, 2000
The writer is executive director of the Grandparent Rights Organization.
